html: The smith…is hungry, and his strength faileth. The smith, who works with his tools to fashion an idol "with the strength of his arms," grows weak with hunger and faint with thirst. Ironically, it is upon the smith's tools, talent, and skillful arm that the god's existence depends, and yet the smith cannot maintain his own strength without outside assistance. How can a supernatural being be created by a frail mortal? (40:19; Jer. 10:3-4).
